page.title: 05BREDHURST SHELTER
page.content: Bredhurst Shelter is a santuary for unwanted cats. It was opened in 1977 by the warden, who became very concerned that cats, unlike dogs, were not recognised as pets by the law. In the summer time, 100 - 120 cats are brought to the shelter for various reasons and they are kept in runs and cages. Some cats are then sold to the public whilst the rest live out their remaining days in the security and comfort provided by the shelter. There is veterinary accommodation for ill cats and the work of the shelter includes neutering and dentistry. The shelter runs a cat sponsorship scheme, whereby people, who cannot keep a pet at home for some reason, can adopt a particular cat and pay for its keep. They can visit it whenever they like.
